columns.name: Extract Run Date
columns.description: Run-date Information to verify recent data

columns.name: Randomized Id
columns.description: A randomly assigned number used to uniquely identify complaints. Rows that contain the same UniqueRandomComplaintId are allegations in the same complaint.

columns.name: Closed Year
columns.description: Year CCRB closed the complaint.

columns.name: Case Type
columns.description: Jurisdiction of complaint description. CCRB cases only.

columns.name: Days From Received Date To Case Closing
columns.description: Days difference between CCRB receiving the complaint to the date CCRB closed the complaint.

columns.name: Re-opened
columns.description: Was the complaint re-opened.

columns.name: Ever On DA Hold
columns.description: Has the District Attorney ever placed the CCRB complaint on hold. Incidents forwarded to the District Attorney take priority and CCRB will resume its investigation when those matters are resolved.

columns.name: Outcome Path
columns.description: Outcome type of CCRB complaint.

columns.name: Case Disposition
columns.description: Administratively Closed: CCRB closes complaint due to administrative purposes.  Alleged Victim Unavailable: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness unavailable when the complainant, victim and/or witness cannot be located after multiple and varied attempts.  Alleged Victim Uncooperative: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness uncooperative when the participation of the complainant, victim and/or witness is insufficient to enable the board to conduct a full investigation.  Closed - Pending Litigation: complaint is closed due to pending litigation of the incident.  Complainant Unavailable: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness unavailable when the complainant, victim and/or witness cannot be located after multiple and varied attempts.  Complainant Uncooperative: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness uncooperative when the participation of the complainant, victim and/or witness is insufficient to enable the board to conduct a full investigation.  Complaint Withdrawn: complaint is closed as complainant withdrawn when the when the complainant confirms they want to voluntarily withdraw the complaint.  Conciliated: process prior to the medation process where the officer was spoken to about their conduct outside the presence of the complainant or victim/alleged victim.  Duplicate - CCRB: complaint is closed as a duplicate if a complaint with the same incident is already being investigated.  Exonerated: if any allegation within complaint is exonerated and there are no substantiated, unsubstantiated, or unfounded allegations.  IAB - Referral: complaint is referred to the jurisdiction of the Internal Affairs Bureau NYPD.  IAB - Staff Referral: complaint is referred to the jurisdiction of the Internal Affairs Bureau NYPD.  Mediated: a complaint may be resolved by mediation, provided the complainant and subject officer agree, and the CCRB Board determines the complaint is appropriate for mediation. Both the complainant and the subject officer must agree to mediate the complaint within  Mediation Attempted: a situation in which an officer agrees to mediate but the complainant becomes unavailable for the mediation (after the complainant first agreed to mediation).  Miscellaneous: complaint is closed for other reasons.  Miscellaneous - Subject Resigned: complaint is closed when the subject officer resigns from the NYPD.  Miscellaneous - Subject Retired: complaint is closed when the subject officer retires from the NYPD.  Miscellaneous - Subject Terminated: complaint is closed when the subject officer is terminated by the NYPD.  OCD - Staff Referral: complaint is referred to the jurisdiction of the Officer of the Chief of Department NYPD.  Officer(s) Unidentified: if CCRB was not able to identify any MOS in the complaint and there are no substantiated, unsubstantiated, unfounded, or exonerated allegations.  Referral: complaint is referrel to agency with jursidiction.  Substantiated (Charges): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Charges.  Substantiated (Command Discipline A): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Command Discipline A.  Substantiated (Command Discipline B): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Command Discipline B.  Substantiated (Command Discipline): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Command Discipline.  Substantiated (Command Lvl Instructions): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Command Level Instructions.  Substantiated (Formalized Training): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Formalized Training.  Substantiated (Instructions): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with Instructions.  Substantiated (No Recommendations): if any allegation within complaint is substantiated with No Recommendations.  Unfounded: if any allegation within complaint is unfounded and there are no substantiated, or unsubstantiated allegations.  Unsubstantiated: if any allegation within complaint is unsubstantiated and there are no substantiated allegations.  Victim Unidentified: complaint is closed as victim unidentified when the victim/alleged victim cannot be identified.  Witness Unavailable: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness unavailable when the complainant, victim and/or witness cannot be located after multiple and varied attempts.  Witness Uncooperative: complaint is closed as complainant/victim/witness uncooperative when the participation of the complainant, victim and/or witness is insufficient to enable the board to conduct a full investigation.

columns.name: Borough Of Incident
columns.description: Borough location of incident.

columns.description: Patrol Borough location of incident.

columns.name: Stop, Question, Frisk Complaint
columns.description: The complaint contains at least one stop, question, frisk, or search of person allegation.

fields.name: Agency

view.description: The New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) is an independent agency. It is empowered to receive, investigate, mediate, hear, make findings, and recommend action on complaints against New York City police officers alleging the use of excessive or unnecessary force, abuse of authority, discourtesy, or the use of offensive language. The Board’s investigative staff, composed entirely of civilian employees, conducts investigations in an impartial fashion. The Board forwards its findings to the police commissioner.
view.emailShareUrl: mailto:?subject=Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) - Complaints Closed&body=Here is a dataset from NYC Open Data that I would like to share with you: https%3A%2F%2Fdata.cityofnewyork.us%2FPublic-Safety%2FCivilian-Complaint-Review-Board-CCRB-Complaints-Cl%2Ffx4z-5xg2

coreView.name: Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) - Complaints Closed
coreView.description: The New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) is an independent agency. It is empowered to receive, investigate, mediate, hear, make findings, and recommend action on complaints against New York City police officers alleging the use of excessive or unnecessary force, abuse of authority, discourtesy, or the use of offensive language. The Board’s investigative staff, composed entirely of civilian employees, conducts investigations in an impartial fashion. The Board forwards its findings to the police commissioner.
